meanings.definition: The act of agreeing or assenting to something.
meanings.sent1: Her accedence to the new rules pleased everyone in the group.
meanings.sent2: His accedence to the terms of the contract was swift and without hesitation.
meanings.sent3: The cat's accedence to wearing a tiny hat for the party brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The accedence of the sun over the horizon marked the beginning of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The accedence of the students to the teacher's instructions was commendable.

meanings.definition: The act of coming to a position of power or authority.
meanings.sent1: After years of hard work, her accedence to the role of manager was well-deserved.
meanings.sent2: The king's accedence to the throne was celebrated with grand festivities.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's accedence to being the leader of the pack surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: His accedence to the top of the corporate ladder was met with envy by his colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The accedence of the mayor brought hope for positive changes in the city.

meanings.definition: The act of taking precedence or priority.
meanings.sent1: The accedence of safety over speed is crucial in driving.
meanings.sent2: In emergencies, the accedence of medical care is of utmost importance.
meanings.sent3: The accedence of dessert over vegetables in his diet made his nutritionist frown.
meanings.sent4: The accedence of family time in his schedule brought him much joy.
meanings.sent5: The accedence of customer satisfaction in their business model led to increased loyalty.
